prompts: Every evening my home Wi‑Fi keeps dropping for 10–30 seconds, then reconnects. Setup: Spectrum 400 Mbps, Arris SURFboard SB6183 modem, TP‑Link Archer AX50 router (firmware 1.0.16), small apartment. Drops happen on both my iPhone 14 and a 2019 MacBook Pro. 5 GHz SSID 'Home‑5G' and 2.4 GHz 'Home‑2G' separated; using WPA2. Channel is set to Auto; Smart Connect off. Signal strength is −48 dBm in the living room. When it drops, macOS shows 'No Internet' but still connected to Wi‑Fi; ping to the router 192.168.0.1 fails during the drop. It seems worse when the microwave is on. I’ve tried rebooting, changing channels to 36/149, and disabling QoS. Any quick suggestions to stop the drops?

Can you help me figure out why my Windows 11 laptop keeps disconnecting from Wi‑Fi during video calls? Details: Dell XPS 13, Intel AX201 adapter (driver 22.250.1.2), Google Nest Wi‑Fi (2 points) in a two‑bedroom condo. Problem: on Zoom or Teams, every 15–20 minutes the Wi‑Fi briefly disconnects and reconnects; Zoom shows 'Your connection is unstable'. Phone on the same network is fine. Event Viewer shows WLAN‑AutoConfig warnings 5002/5102 and 'reason code 34' (handshake timeout). I’ve already: updated router firmware, disabled 802.11r fast roaming, forced the laptop to 5 GHz preferred, and turned off power saving for the adapter. RSSI sits around −60 dBm. Any ideas on settings to change or tests to run?

I'm trying to pair my Sony WH-1000XM4 headphones with my MacBook Pro (macOS Sonoma 14.4). They show up in the Bluetooth list, but when I click Connect it spins for about 10 seconds and then says 'Connection Rejected.' They pair fine with my iPhone. I've already toggled Bluetooth off/on and restarted the Mac. What else can I try to get them to pair?

After updating my Samsung Galaxy S22 to Android 14, my JBL Flip 5 speaker won't pair. The phone sees 'JBL Flip 5' and when I tap it, I get 'Couldn't pair. Check PIN and try again,' but there's no PIN prompt. I've already 'Forgot' the device and rebooted both. Can you give me step-by-step fixes (like resets or clearing Bluetooth cache) to make it pair?

My Windows 11 laptop has gotten painfully slow over the last week, especially right after boot. Task Manager shows Disk at 100% for several minutes, with SysMain and Antimalware Service Executable near the top. Specs: i5-8250U, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB SATA SSD with ~20 GB free. It seemed to start after a recent update (OS Build 22631.3880). What are the quickest steps I can try to speed things up without reinstalling Windows? Please suggest concrete actions (e.g., specific settings to toggle like SysMain/Indexing, startup apps to disable, disk cleanup targets), and how to quickly check if the SSD might be failing (SMART/health).

My MacBook Air (M1, 8 GB RAM, macOS Sonoma 14.5) keeps beachballing when I have Zoom open and ~10 Chrome tabs. Activity Monitor shows memory pressure turning yellow and swap used around 3 GB; storage has only ~6 GB free. It runs warm but not hot. What are a few practical fixes I can try right now to make it feel snappier? Please include whether low free disk space could be the cause, what to safely delete or disable, whether using Safari would help, and any memory/Spotlight settings to tweak.

My Pixel 7 (Android 14, May patch) is draining way faster than usual. It drops ~25% overnight in airplane mode and gets warm during light browsing. Battery usage shows: Google Play services 19%, Android System 16%, Chrome 12%, Instagram 10%. Adaptive Battery is on, 5G is enabled, AOD on, and I use a Pixel Watch. What are the top 5 things I should try to diagnose and fix this, and how can I tell if the battery itself is failing?

My iPhone 12 (iOS 17.5.1) with 85% battery health is losing ~15–20% per hour on light use. I have Background App Refresh on for most apps, two location-based widgets, and Wi‑Fi/5G always on. Can you give me a concise checklist to isolate any rogue app/process, the key settings to tweak first, and when it’s time to consider a battery replacement?

iPhone 13 on iOS 17.2.1. Your MyBudget app (v5.4.2) started crashing immediately on launch after today’s update. It shows the splash screen for a second then closes—no error dialog. I’ve tried force-quitting, rebooting, reinstalling twice, toggling Airplane Mode, turning off iCloud sync, and ensuring I have 12 GB free space. Still crashes. Anything else I can try? Only crash note I can find in Settings > Privacy & Security > Analytics is: “Exception Type: EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV).”

Pixel 7 on Android 14 (January patch). The Acme Notes app 3.1.0 from Play Store crashes right after I tap it—worked yesterday before the update. I cleared cache/data, reinstalled, tried Safe Mode, disabled battery optimization, and updated Google Play services—no change. From a bug report logcat I saw: “java.lang.IllegalStateException: Default FirebaseApp is not initialized in this process … at com.google.firebase.FirebaseApp.getInstance”. Any workaround I can try while you investigate?

My HP OfficeJet 5255 won’t print from my Windows 11 laptop over Wi‑Fi. Windows shows it as “Offline” and jobs just sit in the queue. I can print a network test page from the printer, and I can ping its IP (192.168.1.53). I’ve restarted printer/router/PC, unchecked “Use printer offline,” ran the troubleshooter, and removed/reinstalled via HP Smart. Can you give me a short set of steps to bring it back online (e.g., Standard TCP/IP port vs WSD, SNMP status, port settings)?

On my MacBook (macOS Sonoma 14.5), my Brother HL‑L2395DW over Wi‑Fi won’t print and shows “Filter failed” in the queue. Scanning still works and the printer’s web page opens at http://192.168.0.27. I originally added it with AirPrint. What’s the quickest fix—should I reset the printing system and re-add it (AirPrint vs Brother driver), and are there any files or caches I should delete to resolve the filter error?

Windows 11 won’t recognize my Epson Perfection V39 USB scanner. In Device Manager it shows as “Unknown USB Device (Device Descriptor Request Failed)” (Code 43). I’ve tried multiple USB ports (2.0 and 3.0), a different cable, uninstalling/reinstalling Epson Scan 2 and drivers from Epson’s site, and rebooting. The scanner’s LED powers on. Can you give me a short checklist of things to try (e.g., power management, WIA service, chipset/USB drivers) to get it detected?

On my MacBook Air (M2, macOS Sonoma 14.4), my HP LaserJet Pro MFP M227fdw prints fine over Wi‑Fi but the scanner isn’t recognized. Image Capture says “No scanners available,” and HP Smart only shows the printer. The printer’s info page shows AirPrint and AirScan enabled, IP 192.168.1.52. macOS firewall is on (default). What are the quickest steps to make the scanner appear in Image Capture/Printers & Scanners without installing a bunch of extra software?

On my iPhone 14 running iOS 17.2, the Gmail app won’t sync in the background—new emails only show up when I open the app and refresh. Notifications are enabled, Background App Refresh is on, Low Power Mode is off, Fetch is set to Automatically, and I’ve reinstalled the app and reset network settings. My Google account has 2FA and works fine on the web. What else should I check to restore background push/fetch for Gmail on iOS?

My Samsung Galaxy S22 (Android 14) has stopped syncing my work email in the Outlook app (Microsoft 365/Exchange Online). After I changed my password, it keeps saying “Account needs attention” and no new mail arrives unless I remove/re-add the account, then it breaks again. I’ve cleared cache, disabled battery optimization and Data Saver for Outlook, allowed background data, and confirmed the account works on desktop. Can you give me a short troubleshooting checklist to get mail syncing again (including any device admin/MDM or certificate steps)?

My Windows 11 laptop suddenly stopped loading any web pages, but other devices on the same Wi‑Fi work fine. Chrome shows DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN for google.com and others; Edge says "Hmmm… can't reach this page." ipconfig /all shows DHCP-enabled with DNS pointing to 192.168.1.1. I've already tried: rebooting router and laptop, ipconfig /flushdns, ipconfig /release and /renew, netsh winsock reset, disabling IPv6, and turning off the Windows Defender firewall. I can ping 8.8.8.8 successfully, but ping google.com fails. What else should I check to fix this DNS issue?

Is the site https://www.reddit.com down or is it just me? On my Mac (macOS Sonoma), both Safari and Chrome time out with ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT, but most other sites load fine. I tried incognito, cleared cache, turned off AdGuard, and changed DNS to 1.1.1.1/8.8.8.8. On my home Wi‑Fi it won’t load, but it loads immediately over my phone’s hotspot. Any ideas what could be blocking it on my home network and how to fix it?

Hi, I’m trying to log into my AcmeCloud account but my password isn’t working. When I click “Forgot password,” it says a reset link was sent, but I’m not getting any email. My account email is myname+acme@gmail.com. I checked Spam/Promotions, searched my inbox, and added no-reply@acmecloud.com to contacts. I’ve tried multiple times over the last hour from both desktop and mobile. I don’t use Google SSO. What else can I try so the reset email actually arrives, and is there a way to confirm if my account is tied to a different email?

Help—I can’t log in to my FinTrack account because it’s asking for a 6‑digit code from my authenticator app, but I changed phones and no longer have it set up. I don’t have backup codes. Username: jholloway87, email: jholloway87@outlook.com (I still have access to this email). What are the usual steps to recover access or disable 2FA in this situation, and what info should I be ready to provide to support?

Windows 11 update keeps getting stuck/undoing changes—how do I fix this without reinstalling?

Device: Dell XPS 13 7390, Windows 11 23H2.
Symptom: The cumulative update (KB5031354) downloads, installs to about 61%, reboots, then says "We couldn't complete the updates. Undoing changes." It loops every time.
What I've tried: Windows Update Troubleshooter, sfc /scannow (no issues), DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth, stopped WUA service and cleared SoftwareDistribution and Catroot2, disabled third‑party AV, unplugged peripherals, 100+ GB free.
Any step-by-step fixes I can try (like installing the update offline, hiding a problematic driver, or using in-place repair) to make it complete successfully?

iPhone update stuck—how do I get past "Preparing Update"?

I'm trying to update my iPhone 13 from iOS 17.6 to iOS 18.1. It's been stuck on "Preparing Update" for over an hour. I have 20 GB free, battery over 80% and plugged in, strong Wi‑Fi, Low Power Mode off. I've restarted the phone and deleted/re-downloaded the update once. What else can I safely try to get it to finish without wiping the phone?

Windows 11 Pro 23H2 on a Dell XPS 13 9310 (i7‑1165G7, 16 GB, Intel Iris Xe). I keep getting a blue screen once or twice a day with “IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL” and stop code 0x0000000A, usually right after I plug into my USB‑C dock or wake from sleep. Drivers are up to date via Windows Update and Dell Command Update; BIOS 3.16.0. Can you briefly explain what this BSOD typically indicates and give me a short, prioritized list of quick checks/fixes to try first?

Gaming BSOD help: Windows 10 22H2, Ryzen 5 3600, RTX 3070, 32 GB DDR4‑3200, B450 motherboard, EVGA 650W PSU. During long sessions of Cyberpunk 2077 I get “WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR” (BugCheck 0x124). HWiNFO shows CPU temps <80C, GPU <75C. WinDbg on a minidump points to ‘Machine Check Exception’ with ‘Cache Hierarchy Error’ on processor core 2. Could you outline a concise troubleshooting plan (in order) to isolate whether this is CPU, RAM, motherboard, GPU, or PSU related?

My Windows 11 laptop (Dell XPS 15 9510: i7-11800H, RTX 3050 Ti, 16 GB RAM) overheats when gaming. In Cyberpunk 2077 the CPU hits 95–100°C and the GPU ~85°C within 10 minutes; HWInfo shows thermal throttling and FPS tanks. Ambient is ~24°C. I’ve updated BIOS and GPU drivers, set Windows power to Balanced, cleaned vents with compressed air, and I’m using a cooling pad. Could you give me a prioritized checklist to bring temps down (in‑game settings, power/volt limits, fan control, repaste/repadding, etc.) and what temperatures are actually safe for this hardware?

2019 13-inch MacBook Pro (Intel) on macOS Sonoma: during Zoom calls with ~15 Chrome tabs, the fans roar, the bottom gets very hot, and the battery drains even while plugged in. Activity Monitor shows kernel_task and Google Chrome Helper using lots of CPU. Room is ~29°C and I sometimes use the laptop on a blanket. I haven’t cleaned the internals. What practical steps can I take right now to reduce heat and noise (macOS settings, app choices, ventilation/cleaning, Zoom/Chrome tweaks), and how do I know if this is normal vs true overheating I should worry about?

Windows 11 laptop won't detect my external monitor. Dell XPS 13 9310 (Intel Iris Xe, Win11 23H2) to a Dell U2720Q. I've tried: USB-C to DP cable direct to the monitor, and HDMI via an Anker USB-C hub. The monitor powers on but shows 'no signal,' and Windows Settings > System > Display doesn't see anything (Detect does nothing). Updated BIOS, Intel graphics driver, and Thunderbolt firmware; power-cycled everything; tried different ports/cables. The monitor works fine with my PS5. Can you give me a concise troubleshooting checklist to figure out if this is a cable/alt-mode issue, driver, or hardware port failure?

MacBook Air M2 on macOS Sonoma 14.5 isn't seeing my LG 27UL500 when connected via a USB-C to HDMI adapter (Anker) with a 4K HDMI cable. The LG says 'No signal,' and System Settings > Displays only shows the built-in display. I've tested the monitor and cable with another PC and they work. I've tried a different HDMI adapter, rebooted, and toggled the monitor's input. What quick steps should I try next to get macOS to detect the external display (e.g., cable types to prefer, resets, settings), ideally without a long reinstall or deep diagnostics?

My USB microphone isn't being detected on Windows 11. In Device Manager it shows up with a yellow exclamation mark under Sound, video and game controllers. I’ve tried multiple USB ports and a different cable. What quick steps can I take to fix the driver/permissions so apps like Zoom and Discord see it?

On my MacBook Air (M2, macOS 14 Sonoma), the built-in mic stopped working. System Settings > Sound shows the internal mic but the input level never moves, and Voice Memos says there’s no input. I’ve rebooted and reset NVRAM/SMC. Can you give me a short checklist to figure out if it’s a permissions/input-source issue or a hardware problem?

Windows 11 help: My laptop’s built-in webcam isn’t recognized by anything (Zoom, Teams, Camera app). In the Camera app I get “We can’t find your camera” with error 0xA00F4244 (NoCamerasAreAttached). In Device Manager I don’t see Imaging Devices at all, and there’s no “Camera” category either. I’ve tried: checking Privacy & security > Camera (apps are allowed), Windows Update, Scan for hardware changes, reinstalling the Camera app, and restarting. I also toggled the camera hotkey (Fn+F8 on this Lenovo) and checked for any physical shutter (it’s open). No luck. Any concise steps to make Windows detect the camera again, including BIOS/UEFI or driver tips?

On macOS Sonoma 14.4, my external USB webcam (Logitech StreamCam) isn’t detected by Zoom, FaceTime, or Photo Booth (Photo Booth says “No camera connected”). The webcam’s LED turns on and it gets power. In System Settings > Privacy & Security > Camera, Zoom and Chrome are allowed. I’m using a USB‑C hub; I tried a direct USB‑C port and a different cable, plus a reboot, still nothing. Can you give me a short checklist to diagnose and fix this (e.g., how to see if macOS sees the camera in System Information, resetting camera permissions, killing VDCAssistant/AppleCameraAssistant, Safe Mode, NVRAM/SMC)?

Windows 11 PC with Logitech Z213 speakers plugged into the green 3.5mm jack on an MSI B550 motherboard. No sound at all. Windows shows Realtek Audio as the default device and the level meter moves in YouTube/Spotify. Volumes are up on Windows and the speaker knob. Headphones work when plugged into the same jack. Device Manager looks fine; I reinstalled the Realtek driver and rebooted. What else should I try to get these speakers working?

My JBL Flip 5 pairs to my iPhone 13 (iOS 18.1) and says Connected, but audio still comes out of the phone—nothing from the speaker for music or calls. I’ve tried forgetting/re-pairing, toggling Bluetooth, and checking volumes. The speaker works fine with my laptop. How can I fix no sound from the speaker on the iPhone?

On my Dell XPS 13 9310 running Windows 11 23H2, several keys on the built-in keyboard randomly stop responding (T, Y, [, ], and Backspace). An external USB keyboard works fine. I’ve rebooted, checked for Windows updates, and confirmed Filter Keys is off. Device Manager shows “Standard PS/2 Keyboard” with no warnings. What quick steps can I try to determine if this is a driver/firmware issue vs a hardware/ribbon problem, and any fixes before I take it in?

My Logitech K380 won’t register Space or Enter reliably when paired with my iPad Air (4th gen) on iPadOS 17.5.1, but it works fine on my Mac. I replaced the batteries, removed/re-paired Bluetooth, and reset network settings. Any concise troubleshooting steps or iPadOS settings I should check to get those keys responding again?

My Pixel 7’s touchscreen keeps going unresponsive in the lower third (the nav bar area) after the Android 14 update. A reboot fixes it for a few minutes, then the dead zone comes back. Safe Mode shows the same issue, and the recovery touch test also won’t register in that area. No cracks; I do have a tempered glass protector on. I tried switching between gestures and 3-button nav, cleaning the screen, and uninstalling recent apps. What else can I try to tell if this is software vs. hardware before I schedule a repair?

iPad 9th gen on iPadOS 17.3: the touchscreen has dead spots and occasional ghost touches when it’s on battery, but it mostly behaves if I plug it into the original Apple charger (or if I’m touching the USB cable shield). This started after I wiped the screen with a slightly damp cloth. I removed the case/screen protector, force restarted, and reset settings. Any at-home troubleshooting to confirm if it’s moisture/grounding-related, and how to dry or mitigate it? How do I know if it needs a screen or charge-port repair?

Windows 11 Pro on a Dell XPS 13 9310: when I plug in a Kingston DataTraveler 64GB, I get “USB device not recognized,” and Device Manager shows “Unknown USB Device (Device Descriptor Request Failed) (Code 43).” Other USB devices work on this laptop, and this flash drive works on another PC. I’ve tried different ports, rebooting, and Scan for hardware changes. What should I try next to fix this?

On my MacBook Air M2 running macOS 14.5 (Sonoma), my Samsung T7 1TB via USB‑C suddenly isn’t recognized—no mount, and Disk Utility doesn’t list it. In System Information > USB, I only see a “USB 3.1 Bus,” not the drive. I tried two cables and both ports; the SSD works on my Windows PC. What are the most likely causes and a few troubleshooting steps I can try on macOS?

Ubuntu 22.04 VM just hit “No space left on device.” Here are some details:

$ df -h
Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/sda1        40G   39G     0 100% /
tmpfs           794M  4.0M   790M   1% /run
udev            3.9G     0   3.9G   0% /dev
/dev/sdb1       100G   10G    85G  11% /data

$ sudo du -xh --max-depth=1 /var
8.0G    /var/lib/docker
3.2G    /var/log
900M    /var/cache
200M    /var/lib/apt

$ docker system df
TYPE            TOTAL     ACTIVE    SIZE      RECLAIMABLE
Images          15        4         7.84GB    4.12GB (52%)
Containers      12        6         2.3GB     1.1GB (48%)
Local Volumes   8         8         5.5GB     0B
Build Cache               0         1.2GB     1.2GB

What are the safest commands I can run right now to free up space (preferably without stopping running containers)?

On macOS Ventura, I’m getting “Your startup disk is almost full.” Storage shows: System Data ~120 GB, Photos 60 GB, Applications 35 GB. I use iCloud Photos with Optimize Mac Storage turned on, and I sometimes use Time Machine to an external drive. I need to quickly free 30–50 GB safely without breaking anything. What are the best steps/commands to target System Data and other easy wins?

My Windows 10 PC has adware symptoms: Chrome keeps redirecting to 'searchallbest' and an extension called FastFind comes back after removal. Defender says I'm clean. Can you give me a clear, safe cleanup plan: which trusted free tools to run (and in what order), how to reset Chrome/Edge without losing bookmarks/passwords, and what startup/scheduled task items to check? Please avoid registry edits.

My Android phone (Pixel 6) started showing full‑screen ads on the home screen and an app called 'System Update Service' with no icon. Play Protect didn’t flag it. How can I find and remove the offending app, disable its 'Draw over other apps' permission, use Safe Mode if needed, and clean browser notifications, without wiping the phone? A short step‑by‑step would help.

Google Drive for desktop isn’t syncing on my Windows 11 PC. Version 92.0.4.0. It sits on “Scanning for changes” for hours with high CPU, no proxy/VPN, stable internet. About 45k files, mostly Docs/Sheets/PDFs. I’ve tried rebooting, pausing/resuming, signing out/in, clearing %LOCALAPPDATA%\Google\DriveFS\, and a full reinstall. drive_fs.log shows repeating “SyncWorker stalled” entries. What else can I try to kickstart the initial sync or pinpoint the blockage?

OneDrive won’t sync photos from my iPhone to my Mac. iPhone on iOS 17.6, Mac on macOS Sonoma 14.6, same Microsoft account, 50 GB free space. On iPhone, Files app shows OneDrive items as “Waiting to upload”; on Mac, the OneDrive menu says “Up to date.” I’ve toggled Background App Refresh and cellular data, disabled/re-enabled Camera Upload, and reinstalled the iPhone app. Any steps to get mobile uploads to actually sync to the Mac?

On Zoom my video keeps stuttering and audio falls out of sync after a few minutes. I'm on a Windows 11 laptop (i5-1135G7, 8GB RAM) with a 1080p USB webcam, Wi‑Fi 5 GHz. Speedtest ~120 Mbps down/15 up, 20 ms ping. This started after updating to Zoom 5.17.x. Task Manager shows Zoom spiking to 80–90% CPU during calls. I've tried: turning off HD/video filters, switching to 720p, closing other apps, disabling virtual background, restarting router/PC, and updating webcam drivers. Still choppy. Any quick settings or Windows tweaks I should try (e.g., hardware acceleration, QoS, audio processing, power plan) to stabilize the call?

People on my Microsoft Teams calls say they hear a loud echo/feedback when I talk using my Galaxy Buds Pro with a Samsung Galaxy S22 (Android 14). It doesn't happen on WhatsApp or Google Meet, only Teams. Teams version 1416/2024. Tried clearing cache, reinstalling, toggling noise suppression and high-fidelity music, disabling Bluetooth absolute volume, and switching between SBC/AAC. If I use the phone mic + buds for output, echo stops. Any ideas for specific settings or workarounds to fix the echo in Teams mobile?

OpenVPN GUI on Windows 11 won't connect on hotel Wi‑Fi. It hangs at 'Waiting for server' and the log shows: 'TLS Error: TLS key negotiation failed to occur within 60 seconds' and 'TLS handshake failed'. I tried switching UDP->TCP 443, toggled 'Allow fallback to TCP', disabled Windows Defender Firewall, changed DNS to 1.1.1.1, and re-imported the .ovpn. Same profile works at home. Hotel has a captive portal that I accepted. I don't have admin rights on this laptop. Any quick workarounds or settings I can try to get it to connect?

macOS Sonoma 14.5, Cisco Secure Client (AnyConnect) to our company VPN won't connect from home since I changed ISPs/routers. Error: 'AnyConnect was not able to establish a connection to the specified secure gateway.' I can browse to https://vpn.example.com and DNS resolves, but the client fails after a few seconds. I've tried rebooting, reinstalling the client, disabling IPv6, and testing on both Wi‑Fi and Ethernet. Router is likely behind CGNAT. What should I check/change (client settings, ports, MTU, logs) to make the VPN connect?

Netflix won't open on my Samsung Smart TV (model UN55MU7000, Tizen 1290). It used to work, but since yesterday it shows error tvq-pb-101 (1.10.5005) after the logo, then dumps me back to the home screen. Internet works on the TV (other apps stream fine). I've tried restarting the TV, unplugging for 5 minutes, reinstalling Netflix, updating TV firmware, logging out of all devices, and resetting my router. Any ideas what else I can try, like clearing app cache on this model or adjusting DNS settings? Please keep steps specific to Samsung/Tizen.

Need help with YouTube app stuttering on my LG C1 (webOS 6.3.3). 4K videos buffer every few seconds while Netflix/Disney+ are smooth. Wired ethernet, 300 Mbps down, YouTube app version 3.10.124. Started after the last app update. I've toggled Match Frame Rate, disabled Dolby Vision, and rebooted both TV and router. What settings or troubleshooting should I try next (e.g., reset the YouTube app, change DNS, clear cache) to fix the buffering?

My TP-Link Kasa HS103 smart plug won’t connect during setup in the Kasa app on my iPhone. Router is an Xfinity gateway broadcasting 2.4/5 GHz under one SSID with WPA2/WPA3 mixed mode. The app fails with “Unable to connect to your Smart Plug,” and the LED keeps blinking orange/blue (AP mode). I’ve tried factory reset, toggling airplane mode, disabling 5 GHz temporarily, and granting location/Bluetooth permissions. iOS 17.3, Kasa app 3.2.0. Any quick steps to get it connected?

My Google Nest Mini (2nd gen) won’t connect to Wi‑Fi after I changed routers. In Google Home it goes through setup but then says “Couldn’t connect to Wi‑Fi.” I’m on an Eero 6 mesh (single SSID for 2.4/5 GHz, WPA3 enabled), Android 14 phone, and the speaker is ~15 ft from the nearest node. I’ve tried rebooting the Eero, factory resetting the Nest Mini, and forgetting/re-adding in the app. What should I check to get it online?

Since a recent Windows update, I'm getting ping spikes in Valorant. Normally 25–35 ms to Chicago, but every minute it jumps to 150–300 ms for a few seconds. Wired ethernet on 300/20 Mbps cable, DOCSIS 3.1 modem, Asus RT-AX58U router. Win11 23H2, Intel I219-V NIC (latest drivers). I've tried rebooting gear, DNS flush, netsh resets, disabling Game Mode/IPv6, and QoS. Tracert shows a jump at my ISP’s second hop; other devices stream fine. Any other steps to stabilize ping or confirm if the issue is on my end vs the ISP?

On a PS5 playing Warzone, I see 90–120 ms ping in the evenings vs ~25 ms in the morning, with ~20 ms jitter and 1–2% packet loss. Fiber 500/500, wired, Unifi Dream Machine router (SQM off), bufferbloat grade C under load, UPnP on, NAT Type 2. What UDM settings (QoS/SQM, bandwidth limits, DSCP/Smart Queues, MTU) should I try to cut jitter/packet loss, and how can I test whether this is ISP congestion versus my home network?

On my Pixel 7 (Android 14), my GPS is consistently off by ~100–200 meters in Google Maps and Strava. Indoors it shows me across the street; outdoors the blue circle stays huge and my route zigzags. What can I do to fix this? Things I’ve tried: toggling High accuracy, Wi‑Fi/Bluetooth scanning on/off, clearing Google Maps and Google Play Services cache, restarting, offline maps, and giving apps Precise location. Any other settings to check, or a way to reset A‑GPS or test if the antenna is failing?

Since updating my iPhone 13 to iOS 17.6, location has been jumpy and slow to lock in Apple Maps and Uber. Compass is often pointing the wrong way. I’m in a dense city, but it used to be fine. Can you give me a short checklist to improve accuracy? I’ve got Location Services on, Precise Location enabled, and I tried calibrating the compass. Should I reset location & privacy or network settings, turn off VPN, or check date/time? Anything else I should do before visiting Apple?

On my iPhone 13 (iOS 17.5.1), I’m not getting lock screen or banner notifications for WhatsApp or Messages—new chats only show up when I open the apps. Focus/DND are off. In Settings > Notifications, both apps are allowed (Banners + Sounds + Badges), Scheduled Summary is off, Show Previews = Always, Background App Refresh is on, and Low Power Mode is off. I rebooted and even reinstalled WhatsApp. I do have an Apple Watch paired but it’s powered off. How can I get notifications to appear again?

Pixel 7 on Android 14: Slack notifications don’t appear unless the app is open. All Slack notification channels are enabled, battery optimization is Unrestricted, Do Not Disturb and Data Saver are off, and I cleared cache. Notification history shows nothing from Slack. Happens on both Wi‑Fi and mobile data. What should I check next to get notifications showing again?

Personal Hotspot on my iPhone 12 (iOS 17.2, T‑Mobile US) stopped working. My Windows 10 laptop and an iPad can't see the hotspot SSID at all unless I open the Hotspot screen, and even then they sometimes connect but there's no internet. I've tried: toggling hotspot/Wi‑Fi/Bluetooth, changing the hotspot password/name, resetting network settings, restarting both devices, Low Data Mode off, and I'm well under my data cap. Carrier Settings show version 56.0.1. Can you give me a short checklist to get hotspot broadcasting reliably again (including anything carrier/APN or Settings -> Cellular I should check)?

USB tethering trouble: Pixel 6 on Android 14 to a Windows 11 laptop. When I enable USB tethering the phone says it's sharing internet, but Windows shows 'Unidentified network — no internet'. pg_dump -U appuser -h prod.db.example.com -d appdb > backup.sql

Source is Postgres 13. On my Mac (Postgres 13.12 via Homebrew), I created an empty local DB "appdb_dev". When I run:

pg_restore -U postgres -d appdb_dev backup.sql

I get: "pg_restore: error: input file appears to be a text format dump. Please use psql." If I use:

psql -U postgres -d appdb_dev -f backup.sql

I then get: "ERROR: role \"appuser\" does not exist". What's the correct way to restore this dump and deal with the missing role?
